summary: Successfully merged complementary features from both branches. HEAD branch added data models (BotState, Trade, Position, MarketData) while main branch added configuration management and utilities. All functionality from both sides preserved.
strategyUsed: Merged both changes - the conflicts arose from two parallel feature developments that are complementary rather than conflicting. Combined imports in __init__.py, merged documentation in READMEs to cover both models and utilities, and unified all dependencies in requirements.txt. All conflict markers removed and files staged.

conflictedFiles.resolution: Combined descriptions - 'with validated data models and utilities' instead of choosing one variant. Merged project structure to include both models.py, config.py, utils.py, and tests/

Created comprehensive documentation that includes both data models section (from HEAD) and configuration/utilities section (from main). Organized into clear sections covering all features from both branches.
Merged both import sets - included both config imports and model imports. Updated __all__ to export all symbols from both branches.
Combined all dependencies from both branches. Kept pydantic[email]>=2.5.0 from HEAD and all additional dependencies from main (dotenv, requests, websockets, TA-Lib, etc.). Organized by category.
